numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The scatter graph shows a comparison between Generation Z and Generation X.
2. Generation Z is 15-24 years old.
3. Generation X is 40 years old or older.
4. In the sample, the younger generation is more optimistic about improvement in the world.
5. The graph can help geographers understand some people's views.
6. The graph can lead to further research.
7. The further research can study why younger generations have a positive prospect about their generation.
8. Mali is a country.
9. Mali is the most pessimistic country in the sample.
10. In the sample, the younger generation in Mali agrees that the world is improving.
11. There are plausible reasons for the optimism of the younger generation.
12. The younger generation was born in a relatively privileged era.
13. The younger generation was born in a relatively peaceful era.
14. Some members of Generation Z experienced the SARS epidemic.
15. Some members of Generation Z experienced the COVID-19 epidemic.
16. Most members of Generation Z have not been hit by reality yet.
17. The capacity of a member of Generation Z to think broadly and critically is inferior to the capacity of a member of Generation X.
18. The youth has baseless ambitions for future success.
19. There are plausible reasons for the pessimism of Generation X.
20. Generation X has most likely been hit by life.
21. Some members of Generation X have given up on some things.
22. Generation X does not have youth.
23. Generation X does not have health.
24. Generation Z has youth.
25. Generation Z has health.
26. The graph shows good news.
27. Improvement of any scale requires people with ambitions.
28. The graph ensures us that members of Generation Z have confidence.
29. The confidence can help to create a better world.
